questions.question: A and B together can complete a work in 12 days. B alone can complete it in 18 days. In how many days can A alone finish the work?
If 24 men can complete a work in 15 days, how many men are required to complete the same work in 10 days?
A does half as much work as B in three-fourths of the time. If together they take 18 days to complete a work, how many days will A alone take?
If A works alone for 3 days and then B joins him, they complete the remaining work in 4 days. If B alone takes 30 days to complete the work, how many days will A take?
A, B and C can complete a work in 10, 15 and 20 days respectively. How long will they take to complete the work if all three work together?
A completes a work in 8 days. B is 60% more efficient than A. In how many days will B complete the same work?
If 4 men working 6 hours a day can dig a ditch in 8 days, how many men will be required to dig it in 4 days working 12 hours a day?
A and B working together can complete a job in 7.5 days. B and C working together can complete it in 5 days. A and C working together can complete it in 10 days. How long will A take working alone?
A can do a work in 25 days. B can do it in 20 days. If A, B and C working together can finish it in 8 days, in how many days can C alone do it?

A starts work and leaves after 3 days. B starts after A leaves and works for 5 days. The remaining work is completed by C in 2 days. If A, B and C working together can complete the work in 8 days, how many days will it take if A works alone?
Two workers A and B working together can complete a task in 12 hours. If A works alone for 2 hours and then B joins, they finish in 8 more hours. How long will A take working alone?
A can complete 1/4 of a work in 10 days. B can complete 1/3 of the work in 12 days. In how many days will both complete the work together?
If A does 3/5 of the work in 9 days, how many days will be required to complete the whole work?
A completes a work in 12 days, B in 15 days. They start together but A leaves after 4 days. In how many more days will B complete the remaining work?
A, B and C can complete a project in 20, 30 and 60 days respectively. In how many days will they complete it if they work on alternate days starting with A?
If 10 workers can build a wall in 12 days, how many workers are needed to build it in 8 days?
A works twice as fast as B. If together they complete a work in 6 days, how many days will A take?
A takes 6 days to complete a work and B takes 9 days. A leaves after 2 days, B continues. In how many more days will B complete?
A, B and C working together earn Rs. 1200 for a job. A, B and C's work rate is 4:3:2. How much should A get?
A can do a piece of work in 10 days, B in 12 days and C in 15 days. They work for 2 days and then C leaves. In how many more days will A and B complete it?
The ratio of the ages of A and B is 4:5. After 8 years, the ratio becomes 5:6. What is A's present age?
If A:B = 3:4 and B:C = 5:6, find A:B:C
The ratio of two numbers is 5:8. If their sum is 65, find the numbers.

The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2. If there are 120 students in total, how many girls are there?
If A:B = 2:3 and B:C = 4:5, find A:C
The ages of A and B are in the ratio 7:5. In 10 years, the ratio will be 9:7. Find their current ages.
A number is divided into two parts such that one part is 4 times the other. If the smaller part is 25, what is the number?

The ratio of length to width of a rectangle is 5:3. If the perimeter is 80 cm, find the length.
A sum of Rs. 1320 is divided among A, B, and C in the ratio 2:3:5. How much does C get?
If the ratio of A to B to C is 3:4:5 and their sum is 360, find B.
Two friends A and B have money in the ratio 5:7. After A receives Rs. 100 and B receives Rs. 50, the ratio becomes 4:5. How much money did each have initially?
In a bag, the ratio of red to blue balls is 3:2. If there are 60 balls in total, how many red balls are there?
The ratio of A's income to B's income is 5:4. A's income is Rs. 40,000. What is B's income?
If a:b = 3:2 and b:c = 4:5, find a:b:c
A number is divided in the ratio 7:5. If the difference between the parts is 24, find the number.

If p:q = 2:3, q:r = 4:5, and r:s = 3:2, find p:s

A person walks at 5 km/h and covers a certain distance in 6 hours. If he walks at 6 km/h, how long will it take?
